metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3189 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: Use-after-free vulnerability in bzip2recover in bzip2 1.0.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted bzip2 file, related to block ends set to before the start of the block.

notes.Note: msalvatore> Fix for xenial and trusty can be found in 10.0.6-8.1

criterions.comment: bzip2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
